content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 6 to node 2 in the provided graph is:

6 -> 5 -> 4

Note that the path is shortest because it uses only two edges (6->5 and 5->4) instead of three or more. The path is not necessarily unique, but it is the shortest path that uses only the edges provided in the graph.

The shortest path from node 6 to node 5 and node 5 in the provided graph is:

6 -> 5

Note that the path is shortest because it uses only one edge (6->5). The path is not necessarily unique, but it is the shortest path that uses only the edges provided in the graph. The provided graph has only one shortest path for each of the two different destination nodes, because they are the same node after the endpoint is changed to the previous point.
